pullRequest.title: Clean up naming of views endpoints in api browser
pullRequest.bodyText:
Removed "Enterprise/" prefix for new views endpoints and added "Legacy/" for old ones.
Fixes #7150
Left DecoratorResource untouched: 
  
    
      graylog2-server/graylog2-server/src/main/java/org/graylog2/rest/resources/search/DecoratorResource.java
    
    
         Line 52
      in
      c02f86d
    
    
    
    

        
          
           @Api(value = "Search/Decorators", description = "Message search decorators") 
        
    
  


It technically is an old resource but views depend on it and we should move it to the views package imo.
Motivation and Context
Views is not an Enterprise feature anymore and we want to clearly mark the old endpoints as legacy to discourage users from depending on them.
How Has This Been Tested?
Manual review in local dev environment
Types of changes

 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

commit.message:
Clean up naming of views-related resources in api browser

- removed "Enterprise/" prefix
- removed deprecated (and unused) property "description"
Added prefix "Legacy/" to old search resources in api browser

Changed name of new SavedSearchesResource in api browser

Changed "SavedSearches" to "Search/Saved" to consistently align it with other search endpoints
Added prefix "Legacy/" to old dashboard resources in api browser

nodes.bodyText: I think this should be more precise, maybe "Views Sharing"?

commit.message:
Changed api browser name of `ViewSharingResource`...

from `Views` to `ViewSharing`
